glsa.title: PhpWiki: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in PhpWiki allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: PhpWiki is an open source content management system written in PHP.

description.p: Harold Hallikainen has reported that the Upload page fails to properly check the extension of a file.

impact.p: A remote attacker could upload a specially crafted PHP file to the vulnerable server, resulting in the execution of arbitrary PHP code with the privileges of the user running PhpWiki.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PhpWiki users should upgrade to the latest version:
